name: Queueing System with Breakdowns

version-history.notes: Made the buffer size an open parameter.

author: Arnd Hartmanns <a.hartmanns@utwente.nl>
description: A queueing system consisting of a buffered server processing tasks from ten sources of two different types (five each). All components (server and sources) can fail. There is a single repairman with a nondeterministic repair policy. The model corresponds to the system described in Section 4.4 of Kroese and Nicola [1] except for the centralised repairman with a single repair rate.

properties.name: Min
properties.description: The minimum probability for the buffer to become full before ever being empty.

properties.name: Max
properties.description: The maximum probability for the buffer to become full before ever being empty.
